LanguageData.MG_Cluture.label: Tengger
LanguageData.MG_Cluture.description: The Mongolian culture inherited from the old China mainly focuses on the worship of Changshengtian (Tengeri). This belief is more common in nomadic tribes in the marginal world. The colonists who use this as their totem prefer to adopt a grazing life with no fixed place , of course, there are also some who like to plunder other factions with prosperous settlements. \n\nThe Tengri tradition prefers those related to Mughal culture.
